title: Geth 1.4.18 syncing is very slow
body:
#### System information

```
$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.4.18-stable
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.6
OS: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go
```
#### Actual behaviour

Syncing happens at speed ~2-3 blocks / per minute. That is nonsense, it is slower than generating new blocks.
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Just running geth with no parameters. I tried to increase cache up to 3072 MB, but that does not help.
#### Log

```
$ geth --cache=3072
```

```
> eth.syncing
{ 
  currentBlock: 2383438,
  highestBlock: 2514327,
  knownStates: 0,
  pulledStates: 0,
  startingBlock: 2381694
}
```

According to iotop, geth is constantly reading the disk at speed 1 - 2 MB/sec and rarely writing something back.

It took 9 hours to download old ~1800 blocks. Within this timeframe about ~3200 new blocks were generated.

Please start over with an empty chain data and do a fast sync so you don't have to crunch through all the attack bloat. Also run with an increased cache:

e.g. `geth --fast --cache=1024 console`

Note, you'll need to move your old chandata folder somewhere else or delete it to enable fast sync.
fast sync has problem and doesn't work

Fast sync works usually, so if you have problems it means there's some corner case. I would be happy to look at it but please send us some logs or describe what you're seeing, otherwise there's not much we can do.

Is it normal to sync 935 blocks in 4 hours?
[https://gist.github.com/spixy/48f4cccdb61a20f679b5e5e6ae6746c1](https://gist.github.com/spixy/48f4cccdb61a20f679b5e5e6ae6746c1)

I removed blockchain folder as you sugested and started as `geth --fast --cache=1024`
First blocks were synced fast but these newer blocks are slow as hell.

> I removed blockchain folder as you sugested and started as geth --fast --cache=1024
> First blocks were synced fast but these newer blocks are slow as hell.

Same here. Hanging at 2396939 now.
i had given up and spent close to a week muscling threw the ddos blocks. if you can process threw them the latest blocks are fine.

If you don't have a SSD, forget using ethereum and switch back to using cigarettes for barter or something.

If you do have an SSD, wait 2 days for it to sync. Delete old chains and completely restart the sync. Don't send money to any addresses created on the node because you wont be able to send until the sync is complete. 

Sometimes the market value will crash while you are waiting for the sync to complete. I recommend installing installing a boxing bag and pasting pictures of developer avatar's on the bag before you start your daily venting session.

We are still waiting for another hard fork bbq to completely solve this problem.

Syncing geth even with --fast on a machine with a regular sata HDD is not even feasible (still).  Gave up and copied the blockchain from a machine with an SSD.

This really is bad.  (Geth 1.5.6, windows 7).
We're working on database changes to make sync with HDD better.

I dont know, from some point sync became painfully slow even on SSD...
(16gb ram, i5-6600, 100 mbps download, but I havent tried newest versions)

@spixy What version are you using?  I am having sync issues on an old HP Laptop HDD with Win 7 using Geth 1.5.7.  I synced this IBM Thinkcentre Win 7 Pro using Geth 1.5.6 and have had no trouble.  I just filed an issue in Mist channel that devs labeled as a bug because Mist 0.8.8 is not adding 0x prefix to certain contract creations and am wondering if this bug could be contributing to my sync issues on laptop.

This blockchain stuff is all well and good, and makes for exciting Ted talks but it is the LEAST user friendly product out there!? You want to change the world? Make the shit accessible. If Joe Bloggs needs to write code and spend a week syncing to the blockchain then sorry, your revolutionary version of the future is dead in the water folks.

Geth is not meant for average joe. Geth is meant for developers to build shiny toys for average joe. Light clients can sync the newtork within half a minute, you just don't know what that is and how it works.

If you're an averag Joe, please stick to the many awesome user friendly prodicts built on our foundations like Mist or Status. Even those need still time to mature.

Also blockchains are an infrastructure, not an end product. The moment you tell me how the electric grid works feel free to critisize. Until then...

Good attitude. You plebs pay us for our shit that we're not going to tell you anything about other than that it's too awesome for you. Oh and by the way, how many shiny products have been built on the Bitcoin blockchain......? That's right - 0 All these will ever be is cryptocash generators unless attitudes and approaches change.

Feel free to look for alternatives. Your attitude is not needed here.

Look in the mirror, dude.

Hello! This Amanda from tech support, how may I address your issue? Is there something we can do for you? Do you have idea or suggestions on how we may or may not address you tech issue? What? You didn't have a technical issue? Oh! But fine sir, geth is a command line utility, used by not mere ordinary people! It's used by developers and people who know how to operate on the command line. We are also humble and willing to help the ordinary people. How can we help?

Have a nice day!
That's it (were it not for the sarcasm)! An offer of help! Who'd a thunk it? The Technocracy will be televised!
still waiting for those "database" changes to make syncing "faster" on hdd.....
yep...waiting too
Yep, waiting here too. I'm running it with --fast flags and I've increased my cache waaaaaay up.
Still waiting May 7th 2020
I'm still waiting too :)
Folks, I'm not sure if you're still using geth 1.4.18, but if you do, please upgrade!

> Folks, I'm not sure if you're still using geth 1.4.18, but if you do, please upgrade!

I'm using  **1.9.15-stable-0f77f34b** on a server with _32g ram_ and _11Tb hdd raid-0_

You'll need an SSD. The IO ops and bandwidth required are too high for an
HDD yo reliably keep up. Initial fast sync is also extra heavy on disk and
on network too.

On Wed, Jul 22, 2020, 07:07 saeid ezzati <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Folks, I'm not sure if you're still using geth 1.4.18, but if you do,

I'm using hdd with raid-0
admin of server said me it's speed is more than ssd

```
# hdparm -Tt /dev/sda4

   /dev/sda4:
   Timing cached reads:   25122 MB in  1.99 seconds = 12633.44 MB/sec
   Timing buffered disk reads: 786 MB in  3.00 seconds = 261.86 MB/sec
———————————
# sync; dd if=/dev/zero of=tempfile bs=1M count=1024; sync

    1024+0 records in
    1024+0 records out
    1073741824 bytes (1.1 GB) copied, 0.648344 s, 1.7 GB/s
```

Ethereum does fully random disk accesses. HDD is fine for sequential reads/writes, but it will burn when each read is a completely different part of the disk. The head will just keep jumping around randomly.
I buy 8 Tb HDD. And my sync speed is down to 1 block\min... Blocks creating faster than dowloads!!!
